summary: A lengthy, rambling email chain from an alleged Epstein victim to various public figures (including Donald Trump, Rishi Sunak, and media personalities) making numerous accusations about evidence tampering, financial misconduct, and cover-ups related to the Epstein case. The sender demands investigations into multiple individuals and entities, claims their own evidence has been deleted, and references various alleged perpetrators, victims, and attorneys.

persons.name: Rishi Sunak
persons.context: Accused by the email sender of financial misconduct and of having emails deleted from the sender's server. Mentioned as a local MP the sender tried to contact.

persons.name: Donald Trump
persons.context: Addressed repeatedly as "President Trump" by the sender, who requests investigations into Rishi Sunak, media accountability, and protection for their family.

persons.name: David Boies
persons.context: Accused by the sender of conflicts of interest, perverting justice, profiting from Epstein victims, and writing an op-ed on the sender's behalf without consent. Former attorney for the sender.

persons.name: Brad Edwards
persons.context: Repeatedly accused by the sender of being an attorney for Epstein victims/employees, profiting from settlements, silencing the sender, and deleting evidence.

persons.name: Sigrid McCawley
persons.context: Accused alongside David Boies and Brad Edwards of misconduct, profiting from victims, and psychological abuse. Implied to be an attorney who represented the sender.

persons.name: Kash Patel
persons.context: Addressed by the sender to take victim statements, investigate numerous individuals (Rishi Sunak, media, attorneys), and retrieve deleted evidence from devices.

persons.name: George
persons.context: Corresponded with the sender in April 2022 regarding an arrest/case, offering to discuss the matter further.

persons.name: Mike Baker
persons.context: Accused along with Emily Steel of silence and perverting the course of justice for profit regarding the Epstein case and David Boies.

persons.name: Emily Steel
persons.context: Accused along with Mike Baker of silence and perverting the course of justice for profit regarding the Epstein case and David Boies.

persons.name: Daniel Bates
persons.context: Named as a witness by the sender, accused of being a 'bad case of herpes' and told to report information to the FCA about Peter Mandelson.

persons.name: Gayle King
persons.context: Accused by the sender of having inside information on Melinda Gates and others, and withholding crucial evidence. Suggested to do a segment on an unnamed individual.

persons.name: Keir Starmer
persons.context: Accused by the sender of having 'woman issues', profiting from trafficking, and asked when he will acknowledge the UK's role. Told to arrest the sender.

persons.name: Cyril Ramaphosa
persons.context: Accused by the sender of racism, trafficking girls out of South Africa, and protecting witnesses. Demanded to be investigated and arrested.

persons.name: Peter Mandelson
persons.context: Accused by the sender of involvement with Epstein, with the sender claiming to have sold pictures of Mandelson with Epstein to the Daily Mail.

persons.name: Adam Castellani
persons.context: Repeatedly referenced as a colleague of Jes Staley at JP Morgan. The sender claims he moved into their London house and that photos of him have been deleted from their devices.

persons.name: Jes Staley
persons.context: Subject of an FCA investigation regarding false statements about his relationship with Epstein. The sender claims to have evidence and connects him to Adam Castellani.

persons.name: Sergey Brin
persons.context: Accused by the sender of being on Epstein's island and knowing about the trafficking. The sender demands he be prevented from deleting evidence.

persons.name: Rupert Murdoch
persons.context: Accused by the sender of perverting the course of justice and profiting from the Epstein saga. The sender demands he and his son Lachlan be investigated.

persons.name: Lachlan Murdoch
persons.context: Accused alongside his father Rupert of perverting the course of justice in the Epstein case.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: Mentioned as a person of interest to Timea Nagy and as a named defendant. The sender demands a full investigation into his and his family's involvement.

persons.name: Alan Dershowitz
persons.context: Accused by the sender of providing legal services to Prince Andrew during an ongoing criminal investigation, which the sender claims breaks international law.

persons.name: Virginia Giuffre
persons.context: Referenced by the sender as having named a British Prime Minister and Ehud Barak in her testimony. The sender demands she be made to testify fully.

persons.name: Timea Nagy
persons.context: Described by the sender as 'very very bad news' and introduced by Bryn Freedman and Erin (CIA). The sender claims her only concern was Prince Andrew.

persons.name: Erin O'Loughlin
persons.context: Described by the sender as a former friend who witnessed the situation with the attorneys and JP Morgan. The sender provides her contact details to the FCA.

persons.name: Alina Habba
persons.context: Mentioned as someone who has been included in all correspondence and has evidence of what's going on. The sender asks where to send their devices for investigation.

persons.name: Stan Pottinger
persons.context: Mentioned as co-author with David Boies of an op-ed on the sender's behalf. Accused by the sender of trying to get into her 'knickers'.

persons.name: James Marsh
persons.context: Named alongside other attorneys (Boies, Sigrid, Brad) as someone who should be investigated. Accused of being a long-term client of JP Morgan while representing a victim against them.

persons.name: Jennifer Freeman
persons.context: Named as an attorney who falsely represented the sender in a class action and stopped them from testifying against an Epstein employee.

persons.name: Juliette Bryant
persons.context: Accused by the sender of receiving a higher settlement, buying a house quickly in South Africa, and discrediting the sender publicly. Has recorded conversations.

persons.name: Pam
persons.context: Named as a witness by the sender. Accused of helping to traffic the sender and spending Christmas 2006 with them in Epstein's apartment.

persons.name: Sarah
persons.context: The apparent sender of the main email chain, who signs off as 'Sarah' in a reply to George from Rishi Sunak's office.

connections.description: Accused by the sender of working together as attorneys to profit from Epstein victims, silence the sender, and pervert the course of justice.
Accused by the sender of working together as attorneys to psychologically abuse, silence, and profit from the sender and other Epstein victims.
Described by the sender as colleagues at JP Morgan at the same time, linking Staley's false statements about Epstein to Castellani's alleged actions.
The sender (Sarah) claims David Boies was her attorney in her Epstein litigation before she fired him, accusing him of misconduct and conflict of interest.
The sender (Sarah) claims Brad Edwards was her attorney, accusing him of silencing her, deleting evidence, and profiting from her case.
George is identified as working in the 'Office of Rishi Sunak' and corresponded with the sender on Sunak's behalf in April 2022.
Daniel Bates is a journalist implied to work for a Murdoch publication (Daily Mail/The Sun). The sender references Bates's 'boss Rupurt'.
The sender claims Timea Nagy was introduced to them by Bryn Freedman and Erin (CIA).
The sender claims to have sold pictures to the Daily Mail of Peter Mandelson with Jeffrey Epstein, and that they met while the sender was being trafficked.
The sender claims both Sergey Brin and Anne Wojcicki were on Epstein's island with them, and are witnesses.

events.title: Email Demands to President Trump
events.description: The sender emails Donald Trump demanding investigations into Rishi Sunak's finances, retrieval of deleted emails, and accountability for journalists and attorneys involved in the Epstein case.

events.title: Correspondence with Rishi Sunak's Office
events.description: The sender corresponds with George from Rishi Sunak's office regarding an arrest/case (ref: ZA52784). George offers to discuss the matter further if the sender provides a contact number.

events.title: Accusations Against NY Times Journalists
events.description: The sender emails Mike Baker and Emily Steel of the NY Times, accusing them of silence, perverting justice for profit, and demands the SEC investigate them and the newspaper.

events.title: Demand for International Arrest Warrants
events.description: The sender demands international arrest warrants for multiple world leaders (Macron, Cyril Ramaphosa, Zelenskyy, Rishi Sunak, Keir Starmer) for sex trafficking.

events.title: Formal Complaint to UK FCA
events.description: The sender forwards a response from the UK Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) regarding their complaint and evidence about Jes Staley's false statements concerning Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Christmas in Epstein's Apartment
events.description: The sender claims to have cooked roast chicken for 'Pam' and an Eastern European friend in Jeffrey Epstein's apartment on Christmas Day 2006.

locations: Jasmine Cottage, Croft On Tees (Sender's former residence)
keyFacts: The email sender, who signs as 'Sarah', claims to be an Epstein victim whose evidence (emails, photos) has been repeatedly deleted from their Apple devices and servers.

The sender accuses their former attorneys (David Boies, Brad Edwards, Sigrid McCawley, and others) of psychological abuse, profiting hundreds of millions from victims, silencing them, and perverting the course of justice.
The sender connects Adam Castellani (alleged JP Morgan employee) to Jes Staley, claiming they were colleagues and that Castellani's photos have been deleted from the sender's devices.

The sender demands investigations into numerous high-profile figures including Rishi Sunak (for financials and deleted emails), Rupert Murdoch, Keir Starmer, Cyril Ramaphosa, and multiple journalists.

The document includes a forwarded response from the UK Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) regarding their investigation into Jes Staley for making false statements about his relationship with Jeffrey Epstein.
